Bechamel
1 liter milk
2 bay leaves
3 cloves
1/2 medium onion
100g butter
100g flour
1/4 nutmeg
1/8 tsp ground white pepper
salt
  1. Bring the milk to the boil along with bay leaves, cloves and onion, then leave to infuse for up to 20 minutes
  2. In a separate pan, melt the butter before adding the flour. Cook gently for a few minutes, allowing it to bubble, but not long enough that it darkens
  3. Strain the solids from the milk, and whisk into the butter and flour
  4. Add the nutmeg, pepper and salt
Notes
  • Measure how much salt
